  • Method Details

    • getCurrentSong

      Optional<MPDPlaylistSong> getCurrentSong()
      Returns the current song either playing or queued for playing.
      Returns:
      the current song

    • addPlayerChangeListener

      void addPlayerChangeListener(PlayerChangeListener pcl)
      Adds a PlayerChangeListener to this object to receive PlayerChangeEvents.
      Parameters:
      pcl - the PlayerChangeListener to add

    • removePlayerChangedListener

      void removePlayerChangedListener(PlayerChangeListener pcl)
      Removes a PlayerChangeListener from this object.
      Parameters:
      pcl - the PlayerChangeListener to remove

    • addVolumeChangeListener

      void addVolumeChangeListener(VolumeChangeListener vcl)
      Adds a VolumeChangeListener to this object to receive VolumeChangeEvents.
      Parameters:
      vcl - the VolumeChangeListener to add

    • removeVolumeChangedListener

      void removeVolumeChangedListener(VolumeChangeListener vcl)
      Removes a VolumeChangeListener from this object.
      Parameters:
      vcl - the VolumeChangeListener to remove

    • play

      void play()
      Starts the player.

    • playSong

      void playSong(MPDPlaylistSong song)
      Starts the player with the specified MPDPlaylistSong.
      Parameters:
      song - the song to start the player with

    • seek

      void seek(long secs)
      Seeks to the desired location in the current song. If the location is larger than the length of the song or is less than 0 then the parameter is ignored.
      Parameters:
      secs - the location to seek to

    • seekSong

      void seekSong(MPDPlaylistSong song, long secs)
      Seeks to the desired location in the specified song. If the location is larger than the length of the song or is less than 0 then the parameter is ignored.
      Parameters:
      song - the song to seek in
      secs - the location to seek to

    • stop

      void stop()
      Stops the player.

    • pause

      void pause()
      Pauses the player.

    • playNext

      void playNext()
      Plays the next song in the playlist.

    • playPrevious

      void playPrevious()
      Plays the previous song in the playlist.

    • mute

      void mute()
      Mutes the volume of the player.

    • unMute

      void unMute()
      Unmutes the volume of the player.

    • getBitrate

      int getBitrate()
      Returns the instantaneous bitrate of the currently playing song.
      Returns:
      the instantaneous bitrate in kbps

    • getVolume

      int getVolume()
      Returns the current volume of the player.
      Returns:
      the volume of the player (0-100)

    • setVolume

      void setVolume(int volume)
      Sets the volume of the player. The volume is between 0 and 100, any volume less that 0 results in a volume of 0 while any volume greater than 100 results in a volume of 100.
      Parameters:
      volume - the volume level (0-100)

    • isRepeat

      boolean isRepeat()
      Returns if the player is repeating.
      Returns:
      is the player repeating

    • setRepeat

      void setRepeat(boolean shouldRepeat)
      Sets the repeating status of the player.
      Parameters:
      shouldRepeat - should the player repeat the current song

    • isRandom

      boolean isRandom()
      Returns if the player is in random play mode.
      Returns:
      true if the player is in random mode false otherwise

    • setRandom

      void setRandom(boolean shouldRandom)
      Sets the random status of the player. So the songs will be played in random order
      Parameters:
      shouldRandom - should the player play in random mode

    • randomizePlay

      void randomizePlay()
      Plays the playlist in a random order.

    • unRandomizePlay

      void unRandomizePlay()
      Plays the playlist in order.

    • getXFade

      int getXFade()
      Returns the cross fade of the player in seconds.
      Returns:
      the cross fade of the player in seconds

    • setXFade

      void setXFade(int xFade)
      Sets the cross fade of the player in seconds.
      Parameters:
      xFade - the amount of cross fade to set in seconds

    • getElapsedTime

      long getElapsedTime()
      Returns the elapsed time of the current song in seconds.
      Returns:
      the elapsed time of the song in seconds

    • getTotalTime

      long getTotalTime()
      Returns the total time of the current song in seconds.
      Returns:
      the elapsed time of the song in seconds

    • getAudioDetails

      MPDAudioInfo getAudioDetails()
      Returns the MPDAudioInfo about the current status of the player. If the status is unknown null will be returned. Any individual parameter that is not known will be a -1
      Returns:
      the sample rate

    • getStatus

      Player.Status getStatus()
      Returns the current status of the player.
      Returns:
      the status of the player

    • setConsume

      void setConsume(boolean consume)
      Set 'consume' state of the player.
      Parameters:
      consume - should consume be turned on

    • setSingle

      void setSingle(boolean single)
      Set 'single' state of the player.
      Parameters:
      single - should the single mode be turned on

    • getMixRampDb

      Optional<Integer> getMixRampDb()
      The threshold at which songs will be overlapped. Like crossfading but doesn’t fade the track volume, just overlaps.
      Returns:
      the threshold at which songs will be overlapped

    • setMixRampDb

      void setMixRampDb(int db)
      Sets the threshold at which songs will be overlapped. Like crossfading but doesn’t fade the track volume, just overlaps. The songs need to have MixRamp tags added by an external tool. 0dB is the normalized maximum volume so use negative values
      Parameters:
      db - the threshold at which songs will be overlapped

    • getMixRampDelay

      Optional<Integer> getMixRampDelay()
      Additional time subtracted from the overlap calculated by mixrampdb.
      Returns:
      additional time subtracted from the overlap calculated by mixrampdb

    • setMixRampDelay

      void setMixRampDelay(int delay)
      Additional time subtracted from the overlap calculated by mixrampdb. A value of 0 disables MixRamp overlapping and falls back to crossfading.
      Parameters:
      delay - additional time subtracted from the overlap calculated by mixrampdb
